climbs.name: Regular Route
climbs.fa: Cameron M. Burns, Luke Laeser, Aug. 8, 1992

content.description: The route climbs a steep gully on the SW side to access all three main summits.
content.protection: Clean aid gear, a few cams.
content.location: Hike up into the big bowl on the south side of the main summits (there are three). Climb a bolt ladder up a steep gully then rap into a sort of trough. From here, scramble up to any of the three main summits.

content.description: A huge volcanic plug a few miles south of Shiprock. It is on the opposite side of Route 666 to Fird Butte. Both towers are marked on Rand McNally maps.
